actor_awards.notes: A multifaceted entertainer known as 'Mr. Show Business', he was a singer, dancer, actor, and impressionist. He was a member of the Rat Pack and broke racial barriers in the entertainment industry. He received the Grammy Lifetime Achievement Award in 2001 and the Kennedy Center Honors in 1987.

filmography.title: Porgy and Bess
filmography.role_description: The charismatic but unscrupulous drug dealer who tempts Bess with 'happy dust' and a life in New York.
filmography.plot: In the slums of Charleston, a disabled beggar tries to rescue a woman from her violent lover and a drug dealer.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actor in a Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy

filmography.title: Ocean's 11
filmography.role_description: A sanitation worker and former commando recruited to drive a garbage truck for the heist.
filmography.plot: Danny Ocean gathers a group of his World War II compatriots to pull off the ultimate Las Vegas heist.

filmography.title: Robin and the 7 Hoods
filmography.role_description: A gun-toting member of the gang who performs the explosive musical number 'Bang! Bang!'.
filmography.plot: A Chicago gangster tries to improve his image by donating to charity, a musical spoof of the Robin Hood legend.
filmography.awards: Grammy: Nomination – Best Original Score Written for a Motion Picture

filmography.title: Sweet Charity
filmography.role_description: The groovy, psychedelic evangelist and leader of the Rhythm of Life Church.
filmography.plot: A taxi dancer with a heart of gold looks for love in the wrong places, ending up in a bizarre religious gathering.

filmography.title: A Man Called Adam
filmography.role_description: A talented but self-destructive jazz trumpeter struggling with racism, guilt, and addiction.
filmography.plot: A famous jazz musician's life spirals out of control due to his drinking and temper as he tries to deal with a past tragedy.

filmography.title: Tap
filmography.role_description: An aging tap dance legend who encourages the protagonist to embrace his talent. Davis's final feature film role.
filmography.plot: An ex-con and talented tap dancer must choose between returning to a life of crime or pursuing his art.

filmography.title: Salt and Pepper
filmography.role_description: A hip London nightclub owner who gets mixed up in espionage with his partner.
filmography.plot: Two club owners in swinging London are dragged into a plot to overthrow the British government.

filmography.title: One More Time
filmography.role_description: Davis reprises his role as the cool club owner in this sequel directed by Jerry Lewis.
filmography.plot: Salt and Pepper return to investigate a diamond smuggling ring and a murder mystery.

filmography.title: The Cannonball Run
filmography.role_description: A gambler posing as a priest to participate in an illegal cross-country race.
filmography.plot: A wide variety of eccentric competitors participate in a wild and illegal cross-country road race.

filmography.title: Sergeants 3
filmography.role_description: A former slave who joins three cavalry sergeants on a dangerous mission, playing the trumpet.
filmography.plot: Three cavalry sergeants and a trumpet player team up to stop a group of fanatics from seizing the West.

filmography.title: Anna Lucasta
filmography.role_description: A sailor who has a complicated romantic history with the title character.
filmography.plot: A young woman banished by her family tries to start a new life but is pulled back by her past.

filmography.title: Rufus Jones for President
filmography.role_description: A young boy who dreams he is elected President of the United States. Davis's first film role as a child.
filmography.plot: In a musical satire, a young boy falls asleep and dreams he has been elected President.

filmography.title: Convicts 4
filmography.role_description: A prisoner who interacts with the protagonist on death row.
filmography.plot: Based on a true story, a prisoner on death row for murder finds redemption and a reprieve through his art.

filmography.title: Johnny Cool
filmography.role_description: A knowledgeable, dice-playing hipster who aids the protagonist.
filmography.plot: An exiled Sicilian gangster sends an assassin to America to take vengeance on his enemies.

filmography.title: Alice in Wonderland
filmography.role_description: The wise, hookah-smoking caterpillar who gives Alice advice. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: Alice falls down a rabbit hole into a fantasy world populated by peculiar anthropomorphic creatures.

filmography.title: Moon Over Parador
filmography.role_description: He appears as himself, singing the national anthem of the fictional country Parador.
filmography.plot: An actor filming in a fictional Latin American country is forced to impersonate the late dictator.

filmography.title: Gone with the West
filmography.role_description: A charismatic outlaw in this western drama.
filmography.plot: A mysterious gunfighter seeks revenge against the man who framed him and sent him to prison.

filmography.title: The Benny Goodman Story
filmography.role_description: The famous bandleader and arranger who works with Benny Goodman.
filmography.plot: A biopic chronicling the life and career of clarinetist and bandleader Benny Goodman.

filmography.title: Night of the Quarter Moon
filmography.role_description: A singer and friend who supports the couple facing racial prejudice.
filmography.plot: A wealthy San Franciscan marries a mixed-race woman, causing a scandal and a legal battle with his family.

filmography.title: Cannonball Run II
filmography.role_description: Reprising his role as the gambler posing as a priest.
filmography.plot: The racers return for another illegal cross-country race, this time with a mafia kidnapping subplot.
filmography.awards: Golden Raspberry Award: Nomination – Worst Actor (Burt Reynolds)

filmography.title: Pepe
filmography.role_description: A cameo appearance as himself in this star-studded musical comedy.
filmography.plot: A Mexican ranch hand travels to Hollywood to retrieve his beloved horse, meeting many celebrities along the way.

filmography.title: Three Penny Opera
filmography.role_description: The narrator who sings the famous opening number 'Mack the Knife'.
filmography.plot: In Victorian London, the bandit Macheath marries Polly Peachum against her father's wishes, sparking a conflict.

filmography.title: Meet Me in Las Vegas
filmography.role_description: A cameo appearance in this musical set in Las Vegas.
filmography.plot: A rancher finds romance and luck at the roulette tables in Las Vegas.

filmography.title: Save the Children
filmography.role_description: Featured performer in this concert documentary.
filmography.plot: A concert documentary filmed at the 1972 PUSH Expo in Chicago featuring top African-American musical acts.

filmography.title: Broadway to Hollywood
filmography.role_description: An early uncredited role as a young dancer.
filmography.plot: The saga of a vaudeville family through three generations of performers.
